Job Title: Survey Crew Chief

Location: Beech Grove, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Sales

Description:
Survey CREW CHIEF CrossRoad Engineers, PC is looking to expand its team. We are looking for a Crew Chief to be a part of a survey field crew performing a variety of land surveys and staking including but not limited to topographic surveys, route surveys, boundary surveys, ALTA/NSPS Land Title Surveys, construction staking, and right of way staking. Selected individuals must be hard working, dedicated team members that enjoy working primarily outdoors in a fast-paced environment and are willing to learn the necessary skills to be successful and advance in the land surveying / construction surveying field. Overtime is regularly available during the extended construction season. The position requires an interest in technology, problem solving, and producing accurate results. Selected candidates will learn and work as part of a two-person crew. Experience / familiarity in the construction industry is helpful though not necessary. 
 Responsibilities and DutiesHelp perform land survey work using routine surveying practices and equipment.Clearly, accurately, and thoroughly record work performed and conditions using established company procedures and formats.Effectively and professionally communicate with a variety of clients, co-workers and the general public as needed.Work quickly and efficiently to ensure tasks are completed on time.Commute to and from office to job sites daily in survey vehicle.Survey equipment and vehicle upkeep.
Minimum Qualifications High School diploma or GED equivalent0-4 years of experience in performing field surveysEffective and professional written and oral communication skillsEffective interpersonal skillsAble to work 8 or more hours per workdayAble to work 40 or more hours per week as neededAble to work outdoors in a variety of seasonal weather conditions at locations including but not limited to construction sites,  rural areas, downtown city streets, and highways.Ability to traverse uneven or difficult terrain while carrying survey equipment of up to 50 lbs.Able to perform manual labor tasks such as dig and/or probe into pavement or ground for survey information and lift structure lids or coversPossess a valid Driver’s License

The job description does not constitute a contract of employment and the company may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
